answers.answer: Hello,Excessive sweating (Hyperhidrosis) can occur either due to genetic reason or secondary to physiological or disease conditions such as excessive intake of certain foods, caffeine, drugs, nicotine, anxiety, excessively functioning thyroid or pituitary gland, gout, diabetes, menopausal state, neurological causes, certain drugs, certain tumors, etc to name a few more common ones.I suggest you to get it evaluated from a dermatologist and physician both to confirm the diagnosis.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I have this sweating problem that has been going on since mid-September.  It is mild and it occurs all day long.  It lessens at night.  My skin at times feels hot to touch.  The sweating primarily occurs in my lower legs, feet and hands. But it does occur sometime occur on my head. I have no fever and I have measured this many times.  My blood work is normal, Thyroid panel is normal and tested negative for HIV.  Does anyone have a idea what this could be?
title: Mild Sweat
